content.question: Which of the following indicates which block, if either, will transfer energy by conduction at a faster rate, and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: Block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, because the thermal conductivity of the material increases with increasing length
Block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, because there is a greater area in contact with the reservoirs and less distance between the reservoirs

Neither Block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> nor Block <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, because the rate of energy transfer by conduction is an intrinsic property of the material

Neither Block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> nor Block <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, because the decrease in the area that it is in contact with the reservoirs is offset by the increase in the length of the block

content.answer: Block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, because there is a greater area in contact with the reservoirs and less distance between the reservoirs
